Activity2.Description: GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN OFFERS MANY OPPORTUNITIES FOR CITIZENS TO MAKE THE COMMUNITY AN EVEN BETTER PLACE TO LIVE BY HELPING PATIENTS AND MEDICAL STAFF IN A HOSPITAL SETTING. MEMBERS OF THE AUXILIARY HELP TO STAFF AREAS OF THE HOSPITAL, PROVIDING SUPPORT TO HOSPITAL STAFF, AS WELL AS PATIENTS AND FAMILY MEMBERS.COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS PROVIDED GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN WITH MORE THAN 2,085 HOURS OF SERVICE DURING 2009. THEY LEND THEIR TIME AND EXPERTISE TO ASSIST PATIENTS, VISITORS AND OTHER STAFF MEMBERS IN EVERY DEPARTMENT.

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE QUALITY, COMPASSIONATE, AND COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH RELATED SERVICES TO ALL PATIENTS THAT PRESENT THEMSELVES TO US, WHATEVER THEIR NEEDS, REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, OR GENDER.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE QUALITY, COMPASSIONATE, AND COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH RELATED SERVICES TO ALL PATIENTS THAT PRESENT THEMSELVES TO US, WHATEVER THEIR NEEDS, REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, OR GENDER.
IRS990.Description: GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CRITICAL ACCESS HOSPITAL COMMITTED TO PROVIDING QUALITY, COMPASSIONATE, AND COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH-RELATED SERVICES TO ALL PATIENTS THAT PRESENT THEMSELVES TO US, WHATEVER THEIR NEEDS, REGARDLESS OF RACE, CREED, GENDER OR ABILITY TO PAY. LEADERSHIP IS EVER COGNIZANT OF THE RESPONSIBIILTY TO DEMONSTRATE GOOD STEWARDSHIP OF THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS SERVED AND TO THE HEALTH SYSTEM THAT SUPPORTS THE MEDICAL CENTER.GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN OFFERS A BROAD SPECTRUM OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES, INCLUDING 24-HOUR EMERGENCY TREATMENT WITH A LEVEL IV TRAUMA CENTER, INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT REHABILITATION SERVICES, DIAGNOSTIC IMAGING, LABORATORY SERVICES, INPATIENT AND SAME-DAY SURGERY, AND SPORTS MEDICINE GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN STRIVES TO MEET THE HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF ALL CITIZENS LIVING IN NORTHEAST TEXAS. GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN'S SERVICE AREA INCLUDES CASS, MORRIS AND MARION COUNTIES. GOOD SHEPHERD PURCHASED THREE RURAL FAMILY HEALTH CLINICS TO EXPAND SERVICES AND BETTER ADDRESS REGIONAL HEALTHCARE NEEDS. THESE CLINICS OFFER PRIMARY MEDICAL CARE, WOMAN'S HEALTH SERVICES, PEDIATRIC CARE, TREATMENT FOR ACUTE INJURY AND ILLNESS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS EDUCATION, LABORATORY SERVICES AND X-RAYS.GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN MAINTAINS RECORDS TO IDENTIFY AND MONITOR THE LEVEL OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IT PROVIDES TO THE COMMUNITIES IT SERVES. IN FISCAL YEAR 2010, ENDING SEPTEMBER 30, CHARITY CARE BASED ON ESTABLISHED RATES WAS RENDERED IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,673,854. GOOD SHEPHERD PROVIDED CHARITY CARE, GOVERNMENT-SPONSORED INDIGENT HEALTHCARE AND OTHER COMMUNITY BENEFITS COSTING ALMOST $2,037,403 OR 15 PERCENT OF GOOD SHEPHERD'S TOTAL OPERATING EXPENSES. GOOD SHEPHERD'S BAD DEBT EXPENSE FOR THE PERIOD WAS $2,625,866 OR 20 PERCENT OF NET PATIENT REVENUE.GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN ALSO PARTICIPATES IN THE MEDICARE AND MEDICAID PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS OTHER FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL HEALTHCARE REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAMS FOR THOSE IN FINANCIAL NEED. THESE PROGRAMS ACCOUNT FOR A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER'S GROSS PATIENT REVENUE.UNREIMBURSED COST OF PROVIDING HEALTHCARE TO PATIENTS ENROLLED IN THE MEDICARE PROGRAM$1,626,244UNREIMBURSED COST OF PROVIDING MEDICAID AND GOVERNMENT-SPONSORED INDIGENT PROGRAMS$891,788EDUCATION OF PHYSICIANS, NURSES AND OTHER PROFESSIONAL HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS$4,532COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION$9,200TOTAL 2010-2011 BUDGET FOR PROVIDING COMMUNITY HEALTH BENEFITS$3,688,379GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN IS IMPACTED BY THE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN HEALTHCARE TODAY. TO ENSURE THAT GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN IS STRONGLY POSITIONED FOR THE FUTURE, THE FOLLOWING MAJOR STRATEGIES HAVE BEEN ADOPTED.- IMPROVE CLINICAL QUALITY OUTCOMES AND CUSTOMER SERVICE- IMPROVE OPERATING PERFORMANCE AND REDUCE COSTS- DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED DELIVERY SYSTEM AND PROVIDE A FULL CONTINUUM OF HOSPITAL, PHYSICIAN AND INSURANCE SERVICES- IMPROVE THE HEALTH STATUS OF THE SERVICE AREA- IMPROVE THE CAPABILITY AND ADAPTABILITY OF EMPLOYEES AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT HEALTHCARE ORGANIZATION, GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN EXISTS TO BENEFIT THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE PROVISION OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES. GOVERNED BY A VOLUNTARY BOARD OF DIRECTORS, GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN RETURNS TO THE COMMUNITY ALL REVENUE IN EXCESS OF EXPENSES IN THE FORM OF IMPROVED FACILITIES, NEW EQUIPMENT AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN PROVIDED MORE THAN $612,000 IN CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS IN FISCAL YEAR 2010.THE PHYSICAL THERAPY AND SPORTS MEDICINE DEPARTMENT PROVIDES FREE SPORTS MEDICINE PROGRAMS FOR HIGH-SCHOOL AND COLLEGE ATHLETIC TEAMS IN NEED OF TRAINERS OR PHYSICIANS. THIS INCLUDES PRE-GAME PREPARATION, INJURY MANAGEMENT DURING PLAY, POST-GAME MANAGEMENT OF INJURIES, AND AN ATHLETIC INJURY CLINIC DURING FOOTBALL SEASON.MANY GOOD SHEPHERD EMPLOYEES REPRESENT THE HOSPITAL ON NOT-FOR PROFIT BOARDS. SOME EXAMPLES INCLUDE THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR THE COMMUNITY SERVICES OF NORTHEAST TEXAS (HEAD START AND MEALS ON WHEELS), TEXAS MUSIC AWARDS, RELAY FOR LIFE, WILDFLOWER TRAILS FESTICAL AND WINTERFEST, CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND THE TEXARKANA ALZHEIMER'S ASSOCIATION.THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF SERVICES AVAILABLE AT GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER - LINDEN.ANCILLARY SERVCIESHOME HEALTHOCCUPATIONAL THERAPYPHYSICAL THERAPYRESPIRATORY THERAPYSPEECH THERAPYPATIENT AND FAMILY SERVICESSOCIAL WORKCHAPLAINCYMHMR REFERRAL SERVICESEMPLOYEE SERVICESEMPLOYEE ASSISTANCEEMPLOYEE HEALTH SERVICESTUITION REIMBURSEMENTOCCUPATIONAL MEDICINEPRE-EMPLOYMENT TESTINGDOT TESTINGDRUG AND ALCOHOL SCREENINGLABORATORY SERVICESPRE-OPERATIVE TESTINGFULL-SERVICE OUTPATIENT TESTINGMEDICAL/SURGICAL SERVICESACUTE CARE NURSINGGERIATRIC CARE WITH SKILLED NURSING FACILITYCARDIAC REHABILITATIONINFECTION CONTROLREHABILITATIONPSYCHOTHERAPYRESPIRATORY THERAPYMEDICAL IMAGINGDIAGNOSTIC X-RAYCOMPURTERIZED TOMOGRAPHYULTRASOUNDNUCLEAR MEDICINEOTHER SERVICESEMERGENCY SERVICESWOUND CAREEMS SERVICESFAMILY HEALTH CENTERSHUGHES SPRINGS, TXJEFFERSON, TXLINDEN, TX

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The System, GSHS ASO, the Medical Center, GSMC Linden, GSMC Marshall, the GSMC Foundation and the GSMC-Linden Foundation are exempt from income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and a similar provision of state law. These entities are subject to federal income tax on any unrelated business taxable income. Enterprises is a taxable corporation. CSC is taxed as a partnership. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for Enterprises for the tax effects of differences between the financial statements and tax bases of assets and liabilities. A valuation allowance is established to reduce deferred tax assets if it is more likely than not that a deferred tax asset will not be realized. The System files tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction. With a few exceptions, the System is no longer subject to U.S. federal examinations by tax authorities for years before 2007.
PART XII-LINE 2D RENTAL EXPENSES-353 PART XII-LINE 4B AUXILIARY INCOME-3849 PART XIII-LINE 2D RENTAL EXPENSES-353 PART XIII-LINDE 4B AUXILIARY EXPENSES-3,425

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: THE MEDICAL CENTER REPORTS PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED AT NET REALIZABLE AMOUNTS FROM THIRD-PARTY PAYERS, PATIENTS AND OTHERS. THE MEDICAL CENTER PROVIDES AN ALLOANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. AS A SERVICE TO THE PATIENT, THE MEDICAL CENTER BILLS THIRD-PARTY PAYERS DIRECTLY AND BILLS THE PATIENT WHEN THE PATIENT'S LIABILITY IS DETERMINED. PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE DUE IN FULL WHEN BILLED. ACCOUNTS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY WRITTEN OFF AS BAD DEBTS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE ACCOUNT. THE COST OF BAD DEBTS IS THE PRODUCT OF GROSS CHARGES RELATED TO BAD DEBT ACCOUNTS AND A COST TO CHARGE RATIO DERIVED FROM THE HOSPITAL FINANCIALS. THE OPERATING EXPENSES USED TO DERIVE THE COST TO CHARGE RATIO EXCLUDES THE PROVISION FOR UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: Medicare allowable costs were derived from the FYE 09/30/2010 filed cost report. The cost report uses financial and statistical data to develop per diem, per visit and cost to charge ratios that ultimately determine allowable Medicare inpatient and outpatient costs and reimbursement.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: ALL PATIENTS WHO ARE UNDERINSURED OR UNINSURED WILL BE EVALUATED FOR GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS, PAYMENT PLANS, AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. IF ALL ATTEMPTS FAIL, WE WILL CONSIDER EACH ACCOUNT MEETING CERTAIN CRITERIA FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. ANY ACCOUNT THAT HAS A BALANCE GREATER THAN $10,000 AND HAS NOT QUALIFIED FOR MEDICAID OR COUNTY PROGRAMS WILL BE REVIEWED ON PER CASE BASIS FOR CHARITY CONSIDERATION. CREDIT REPORTS WILL BE RUN AND SUBMITTED FOR REVIEW. IF THE PATIENT HAS A CREDIT SCORE BELOW 650, AND THE BALANCE IS COMPLETELY OWED BY THE GUARANTOR/PATIENT ON ANY ONE ACCOUNT, CHARITY WILL BE CONSIDERED 100%. WRITE-OFFS WILL BE MONITORED THROUGH A SPECIFIC CODE TO MONITOR AND EVALUATE AS NEEDED FOR CHANGES OR UPDATES. IF AT ANYTIME RECOVERIES ARE OBTAINED AFTER WRITE-OFF, THE CHARITY ADJUSTMENT WILL BE REVERSED AND ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF THE ACCOUNT WILL BE REQUIRED.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: THE UNITED WAY CONDUCTS A NEEDS ASSESSMENT SURVEY EVERY TWO YEARS TO DETERMINE THE HEALTH NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN USES THIS DATA TO AUGMENT INFORMATION GATHERED BASED ON UTILIZATION OF SERVICES.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: AS PATIENTS ENTER THE FACILITY, SIGNAGE IS POSTED IN DESIGNATED AREAS WHICH STATE THE POLICY TO PROVIDE CHARITY CARE TO THOSE PATIENTS WHO MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS. BUSINESS OFFICE AND REGISTRATION STAFF DISCUSS PAYMENT OPTIONS AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO PATIENTS USING VERBAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION. PATIENTS ARE CONTACTED PRIOR TO SERVICES WITH AN ESTIMATED COST AND OUT OF POCKET EXPENSES. CASH PRICES AND PAYMENT OPTIONS ARE DISCUSSED AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE SCREENING IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN EVALUATES PATIENT APPLICATIONS AND UTILIZES A SLIDING SCALE TO QUALIFY PATIENTS BASED ON GOVERNMENT POVERTY GUIDELINES. ADDITIONALLY, OUR ELIGIBILITY VENDOR SCREENS FOR GOVERNMENT AGENCY PROGRAMS AND OFFERS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE APPLICATIONS TO THOSE WHO DO NOT QUALIFY FOR GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS. BUSINESS OFFICE AND REGISTRATION PERSONNEL ARE AVAILABLE TO ANSWER ANY FINANCIAL QUESTIONS AND ASSIST THE PUBLIC WITH THEIR FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN STRIVES TO MEET THE HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF ALL CITIZENS LIVING IN NORTHEAST TEXAS. GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN SERVICE AREA INCLUDES CASS, MORRIS, AND MARION COUNTIES. GOOD SHEPHERD PURCHASED THREE FAMILY RURAL HEALTH CLINICS TO EXPAND SERVICES AND BETTER ADDRESS REGIONAL HEALTHCARE NEEDS. THESE CLINICS OFFER PRIMARY MEDICAL CARE, WOMEN'S HEALTHCARE SERVICES, PEDIATRIC CARE, TREATMENT FOR ACUTE INJURY AND ILLNESS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS EDUCATION, LABORATORY SERVICES AND X-RAYS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityBuildingActivities: Part VI, Line 5: GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN MAINTAINS A PRESENCE TO PROVIDE HEALTHCARE INFORMATION TO COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE REGION. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION HOSTS AN ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR OFFERING FREE HEALTH SCREENINGS. GOOD SHEPHERD ALSO OFFERS DISCOUNTED MAMMOGRAMS MONTHLY, FREE PROSTATE SCREENINGS ANNUALLY, AND WAS INTERGRALLY INVOLVED IN ESTABLISHING THE MAYOR'S FITNESS COUNCIL. THE COUNCIL PROMOTES ACTIVE LIFESTYLES AND FITNESS THROUGH WALKING AND REGULAR EXERCISE.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: GOVERNED BY A VOLUNTARY BOARD OF DIRECTORS, GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN HAS A DIRECT LINK TO SOLICIT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT IN DECISION MAKING. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS COMPOSED OF GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND TWELVE MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY WHO SERVE ON A VOLUNTARY BASIS TO FURTHER THE MISSION OF GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER-LINDEN. THESE MEMBERS REPRESENT LOCAL BUSINESS, INDUSTRY, EDUCATION, MEDICAL SERVICES AND CONSUMERS-AT-LARGE. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PROVIDES PERPETUAL COMMUNICATION OF THE CONCERNS AND HEALTHCARE NEEDS OF THE CASS COUNTY COMMUNITY AREA.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.AffiliatedHealthCareSystem: Part VI, Line 7: GOOD SHEPHERD HEALTH SYSTEM OPERATES HOSPITALS IN LONGVIEW, LINDEN, AND MARSHALL. IN EACH OF THE COMMUNITIES, THE HOSPITAL OFFERS FREE SCREENINGS TO IDENTIFY EARLY DISEASE, EDUCATIONAL OFFERINGS FEATURING PHYSICIAN SPEAKERS AND CONTINUOUSLY PARTICIPATE IN COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES WHERE PREVENTION AND WELLNESS INFORMATION CAN BE SHARED.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: EDWARD BANOS 40 HOURS JOSEPH REPPERT 0 HOURS PAT KEEL 40 HOURS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOOD SHEPHERD HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. IS THE SOLE MEMBER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: AS THE SOLE MEMBER, GOOD SHEPHERD HEALTH SYSTEMS, INC. HAS THE POWER TO APPOINT ONE MEMBER OF THE BOARD AND DESIGNATE SEVEN MEMBERS OF THE BOARD UPON RECOMMENDATION OF THE CORPORATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A NUMBER OF DECISIONS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OF THE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION. THESE RESERVED POWERS ARE STATED BELOW: A) APPOINT 1 MEMBER OF THE BOARD, AND DESIGNATE 7 MEMBERS OF THE BOARD UPON RECOMMENDATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD; B) REMOVE AND FILL VACANCIES ON THE BOARD AND SET SIZE OF BOARD; C) APPOINT OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION; D) DESIGNATE THE FISCAL YEAR; E) APPROVE THE SELECTION AND REMOVAL OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS, OUTSIDE GENERAL LEGAL COUNSEL AND OUTSIDE INVESTMENT ADVISORS; F) AMEND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION; G) AMEND OR REPEAL THE BYLAWS; H) APPROVAL OF ALL MERGERS, ACQUISITIONS, CONSOLIDATIONS, OR AFFILIATIONS WITH OTHER ENTITIES, THE SALE OF ALL OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THE ASSETS OF THE ORGANIZATION, OR THE SALE, MORTGAGE, OR ENCUMBRANCE OF ANY REAL PROPERTY OWNED BY THE CORPORATION; I) APPROVE TEH DISSOLUTION OR LIQUIDATION OF THE ORGANIZATION; J) APPROVE CAPITAL PLANS, STRATEGIC PLANS, AND ANNUAL OPERATIONS AND CAPITAL BUDGETS; K) APPROVE ANY SINGLE EXPENDITURE THAT EXCEEDS $100,000 AND/OR AGGREGATE ANNUAL EXPENDITURES THAT EXCEED THE BUDGET BY $50,000; L) SELECT OFFICIAL DEPOSITORIES FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S FUNDS; M) CREATING OR INVESTING IN ANY SUBSIDIARY ENTITY OR ENTERING INTO ANY PARTNERSHIP OR JOINT VENTURES; N) AUTHORIZATION OF ANY LOANS, GUARANTEES, OR INCURRENCE OF DEBT; O) THE COMMENCEMENT OF ANY LITIGATION OR OTHER LEGAL PROCEEDING, OR THE SETTLEMENT, DISPOSITION, OR TERMINATION OF ANY SUCH LITIGATION OR OTHER LEGAL PROCEEDING OR OF ANY CLAIM OR THREAT OF LITIGATION OR OTHER LEGAL PROCEEDING NOT FULLY COVERED BY INSURANCE; AND P) APPROVAL OF THE ADMISSION OF ADDITIONAL MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN EXTERNAL ACCOUNTING FIRM PROVIDE A CONSOLIDATED AUDIT. THE 990 IS PREPARED INTERNALLY AND REVIEWED EXTERNALLY. ONCE A DRAFT IS CREATED THE INTERNAL ACCOUNTANTS AND GOVERNING BODY REVIEW THE RETURN PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DISCLOSURES ARE OBTAINED ANNUALLY. THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES BOARD MEMBER DISCLOSURES AND THE CEO REVIEWS AND APPROVES EMPLOYEES. BOARD MINUTE NOTES WHEN A BOARD MEMBER DECLARES A CONFLICT AND DOES NOT VOTE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COMPENSATION SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BOARD NEGOTIATES CONTRACTS WITH EXECUTIVES THROUGH HAY GROUP. THIS SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS AND APPROVES COMPENSATION AND BONUSES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE THAT PROVIDES AND SUBSEQUENTLY REVIEWS THE INFORMATION PROVIDED TO THE EXTERNAL AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE AUDIT IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE BOARD.
